title: U.K. woman rediscovers lost voice with help of AI
description: A British woman suffering from motor neurone disease who lost her ability to speak is once again talking in her own voice thanks to artificial intelligence and a barely audible eight-second clip from an old home video.

title: India Intensifies Focus on Trustworthy AI Regulation
description: TRAI's AI recommendations are under government review, with several initiatives underway to assess the technology's creditworthiness. MEITY is collaborating on projects to test AI trustworthiness, and TRAI suggests an independent statutory authority, the Artificial Intelligence and Data Authority of India, to oversee AI development and regulation in the country.
content: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has submitted its recommendations on Artificial Intelligence (AI) to the government, which are currently under review. TRAI Chairman Anil Kumar Lahoti announced on Friday that the Ministry of Electroni... [680 chars]

title: Google Expands AI Search Mode To 180 Countries With New Personalised Features: Check Details
description: Google is set to expand its artificial intelligence mode in its search engine to 180 countries. Earlier, it was only available in the US, the United Kingdom and India. The US-based tech giant, in a blog post, said that the AI agentic mode will be available in English. “We’re bringing more agentic capabilities and personalised responses to AI Mode in Search, so Google can do more on your behalf and help you get things done,” it said.
content: Google is set to expand its artificial intelligence mode in its search engine to 180 countries. Earlier, it was only available in the US, the United Kingdom and India. The US-based tech giant, in a blog post, said that the AI agentic mode will be ava... [720 chars]

title: AI chatbots triggering terrifying new mental illness in once healthy people, top expert warns - are YOU at risk?
description: In a series of startling posts on X, Mustafa Suleyman, Microsoft's artificial intelligence chief, said that reports of delusions linked to AI use were growing.
content:
Microsoft's artificial intelligence chief has warned of a rise in 'AI psychosis', where people believe chatbots are alive or capable of giving them superhuman powers.
